title: Update tool calling documentation for read_file tool
description:
**As a** Consoul user and developer
**I want** comprehensive documentation for the read_file tool
**So that** I understand how to use it and configure it properly

**Context:**
The read_file tool needs documentation in docs/tools.md similar to the bash_execute documentation. Users need to understand:
- What the tool does and when to use it
- Available parameters and their effects
- Security restrictions and blocked paths
- Configuration options
- Common use cases and examples
- Troubleshooting

**Technical Notes:**
- Update: docs/tools.md
- Add new section after bash_execute (around line 93)
- Follow same structure as bash_execute documentation
- Include configuration examples in YAML
- Document PDF support separately
- Reference security model and blocked paths

**Documentation Sections to Add:**

**1. read_file Tool Overview:**
- Description of capabilities (text, PDF, line ranges)
- Risk level: SAFE (no approval needed)
- Supported file types

**2. Parameters:**
- file_path: Path to file (required)
- offset: Starting line number (optional, 1-indexed)
- limit: Number of lines to read (optional)
- start_page: PDF starting page (optional, 1-indexed)
- end_page: PDF ending page (optional, inclusive)

**3. Example Usage:**
```python
# Read entire file
result = read_file(file_path="src/main.py")

# Read specific line range
result = read_file(file_path="README.md", offset=10, limit=20)

# Read PDF pages
result = read_file(file_path="docs/design.pdf", start_page=5, end_page=7)
```

**4. Security Features:**
- Blocked paths: /etc/shadow, /proc, /dev, /sys
- Directory traversal prevention
- Binary file detection
- Extension filtering (configurable)

**5. Configuration:**
```yaml
tools:
  enabled: true
  read:
    max_lines_default: 2000
    max_line_length: 2000
    max_output_chars: 40000
    enable_pdf: true
    pdf_max_pages: 50
    blocked_paths:
      - "/etc/shadow"
      - "/proc"
      - "/dev"
      - "/sys"
```

**6. Common Use Cases:**
- Reading source code for analysis
- Accessing documentation files
- Reading configuration files
- Extracting PDF documentation
- Reviewing log files with line ranges

**7. Troubleshooting:**
- File not found errors
- Permission denied
- Binary file errors
- Truncation messages
- PDF reading errors
- Empty file handling

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** a user reads the documentation
**When** they want to use read_file
**Then** they can find all necessary information

**Given** a developer configures the tool
**When** they reference the docs
**Then** all configuration options are documented with examples

**Given** an error occurs
**When** consulting troubleshooting section
**Then** they find guidance on resolving the issue

**Testing Considerations:**
- Review documentation for completeness
- Verify all examples are accurate
- Check YAML syntax is valid
- Ensure troubleshooting covers common issues
- Have non-expert review for clarity

**Implementation Hints:**
- Mirror bash_execute documentation structure
- Include both TUI and SDK usage examples
- Add to table of contents
- Cross-reference with configuration guide
- Include security warnings prominently
- Use code blocks with syntax highlighting
- Add visual separators between sections

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content: DOCUMENTATION DEPENDENCIES: This ticket documents start_page/end_page parameters which only exist after SOUL-81 (PDF support) is complete. It also documents the registered tool behavior which requires SOUL-83 (registration). Focus on docs/tools.md following bash_execute structure. Any SDK-specific examples should reference SOUL-83's SDK documentation. New sections to add: 1) read_file overview, 2) Parameters table, 3) Usage examples, 4) Security model, 5) Configuration, 6) Troubleshooting.
